summary:
23. Reiterates the need to enhance cooperation among the CTC, the Committee established pursuant to resolutions 1267 (1999) and 1989 (2011), and the Committee established pursuant to resolution 1540 (2004).

24. Directs CTED to increase cooperation with committees that have mandates established pursuant to various resolutions.

25. Encourages CTED to enhance its dialogue and information sharing with Special Envoys, the Department of Political Affairs, and the Department of Peacekeeping Operations.
The Security Council:

26. Welcomes and encourages the Counter-Terrorism Executive Directorate (CTED)â€™s continued active participation in and support of all relevant activities under the United Nations Global Counter-Terrorism Strategy, including within the Counter-Terrorism Implementation Task Force (CTITF) and its Working Groups;

27. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
